user_error_text: I see High CPU usage and apps take long to open
symptoms: High CPU percentages, system slow, fans loud
cause: Runaway process, background task or malware causing CPU spike
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort by CPU to find the top process; end it if safe.
step_2: Restart the PC to clear any stuck process.
step_3: Disable heavy startup apps: Task Manager → Startup → Disable high-impact apps.
step_4: Scan for malware with Windows Security or a trusted scanner.
step_5: If persistent, update drivers and consider a clean boot to isolate the app.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Disk: High CPU usage - Windows reports 100% disk activity

user_error_text: Disk 100% usage leads to stutter and freeze during tasks
symptoms: Disk shows 100% active time, slow app response, high read/write
cause: Background services, Windows Search, SuperFetch/Storage issues, or failing HDD
step_1: Open Task Manager and identify processes causing disk usage; pause or end non-essential ones.
step_2: Disable Windows Search and Superfetch (SysMain) temporarily: services.msc → stop service.
step_3: Run chkdsk C: /f /r to check for disk errors and bad sectors.
step_4: Check for firmware updates for SSD/HDD and update drivers.
step_5: If HDD is old, consider upgrading to an SSD for better performance.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Disk: Disk 100% usage - Windows reports 100% disk activity

user_error_text: Overheating causing slowdown and system becomes unresponsive at times
symptoms: CPU/GPU temps high, throttling, sudden slowdowns under load
cause: Dust, failed fan, dried thermal paste, poor airflow
step_1: Check vents and clear dust with compressed air (power off first).
step_2: Monitor temps using HWMonitor or similar during light use.
step_3: Ensure good airflow; move laptop to hard surface and avoid soft surfaces.
step_4: Replace or reapply thermal paste and check fans (desktop) or seek technician for laptops.
step_5: Avoid heavy tasks until temps are controlled; consider cooling pad for laptop.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: GPU: Overheating causing slowdown - GPU clock throttled due to temperature

user_error_text: Background apps causing lag — my PC is very slow and responsive lag is high
symptoms: High CPU/RAM usage from background apps, slow UI
cause: Too many startup apps, sync services, or heavy background tasks
step_1: Open Task Manager → Startup and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Check background apps in Settings → Privacy → Background apps and turn off unnecessary ones.
step_3: Pause cloud sync (OneDrive/Google Drive) during heavy use.
step_4: Update or reinstall apps that constantly run in background.
step_5: Schedule heavy background tasks (backups/scans) for off-hours.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Memory: Background apps causing lag - Commit charge high, paging to disk

step_4: Update or reinstall apps that constantly run in background.
step_5: Schedule heavy background tasks (backups/scans) for off-hours.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Disk: Background apps causing lag - Windows reports 100% disk activity

user_error_text: High memory (RAM) usage when many browser tabs open
symptoms: High RAM usage, frequent swapping, slow multitasking
cause: Insufficient RAM for workload or memory leak in apps
step_1: Open Task Manager and sort by Memory to find top consumers; close unneeded apps.
step_2: Restart PC to clear memory leaks.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs and browser extensions.
step_4: Consider increasing virtual memory (pagefile) or adding physical RAM.
step_5: If memory leak suspected, update or reinstall the problematic app.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Perf: High memory (RAM) usage - Process 'SearchIndexer' at 90% CPU

user_error_text: Slow startup / long boot time and system becomes unresponsive at times
symptoms: Long time until desktop appears, many startup processes
cause: Too many startup apps, fast startup issues, or disk problems
step_1: Disable unnecessary startup apps in Task Manager → Startup.
step_2: Turn off Fast Startup: Control Panel → Power Options → Choose what the power buttons do → uncheck Fast Startup.
step_3: Run disk optimization (Defragment for HDD) and check disk health.
step_4: Check for driver issues and BIOS updates that impact boot time.
step_5: Consider a clean boot to identify slow services or reinstall OS if needed.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Disk: Slow startup / long boot time - Windows reports 100% disk activity

user_error_text: Paging / excessive disk swapping leads to stutter and freeze during tasks
symptoms: High disk activity due to paging, system slow when multitasking
cause: Insufficient RAM causing frequent paging to disk
step_1: Check RAM usage and close memory-heavy applications.
step_2: Increase virtual memory: System Properties → Advanced → Performance Settings → Advanced → Change pagefile size.
step_3: Consider adding physical RAM for better performance.
step_4: Move large working files to SSD (if using HDD) to reduce swap latency.
step_5: Monitor for memory leaks or apps that consume excessive RAM.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Thermal: Paging / excessive disk swapping - CPU temp spikes to 95C

user_error_text: I see GPU throttling causing low FPS and apps take long to open
symptoms: Low framerate in games, GPU clocks drop under load
cause: High temps, driver issues, or power limits
step_1: Update GPU drivers and ensure power settings are set to high performance.
step_2: Check GPU temps and ensure adequate cooling; reseat GPU if necessary.
step_3: Lower in-game graphics settings to reduce load.
step_4: Ensure PSU provides sufficient power for GPU under load.
step_5: If persistent, test GPU on another system or consult repair.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: Thermal: GPU throttling causing low FPS - CPU temp spikes to 95C

user_error_text: Antivirus scan slowing system during gaming or video playback
symptoms: System slows significantly during antivirus scans
cause: Full-system scans running during active use
step_1: Pause or schedule full scans during off-hours.
step_2: Exclude large media folders from deep scans if trusted.
step_3: Check antivirus settings for performance-friendly scanning modes.
step_4: Update antivirus definitions and software to latest version.
step_5: If antivirus causes constant slowdown, consider alternative reputable AV products.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.

user_error_text: Antivirus scan slowing system and system becomes unresponsive at times
symptoms: System slows significantly during antivirus scans
cause: Full-system scans running during active use
step_1: Pause or schedule full scans during off-hours.
step_2: Exclude large media folders from deep scans if trusted.
step_3: Check antivirus settings for performance-friendly scanning modes.
step_4: Update antivirus definitions and software to latest version.
step_5: If antivirus causes constant slowdown, consider alternative reputable AV products.

user_error_text: Old HDD slow read/write and system becomes unresponsive at times
symptoms: Slow file transfers, long load times, noisy HDD
cause: Aging HDD with bad sectors or slow RPM
step_1: Backup important data immediately.
step_2: Run disk health check (CrystalDiskInfo) and chkdsk.
step_3: Defragment HDD (only if not SSD) to improve performance.
step_4: Replace with SSD for significant speed improvement.
step_5: Clone old drive to new SSD and test before wiping old drive.
verification: System responsiveness improved; CPU/RAM/disk usage within normal ranges and no long delays.
log_snippet: GPU: Old HDD slow read/write - GPU clock throttled due to temperature
